title.en: Fundamentals of Quantum Computing: Theory and Practice

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course provides an introduction into the basics of quantum computing focussing on problem solving and practical programming while using only a minimal amount of the theory of quantum mechanics. The course is taken before students have completed an advanced mathematics or a quantum physics course
description.et:
Kursuse eesmärk on anda algteadmised kvantarvutusest läbi ülesannete ja praktilise programmeerimise ja minimaalse kvantmehaanika teooria. Kursuse eelduseks ei ole kvantmehaanika kursuse läbimine.

NB! Kursus on küll inglise keeles (kui vähemalt üks osavõtja ei valda eesti keelt), kuid soovi korral vastame küsimustele ning anname konsultatsiooni ja tagasisidet eesti keeles.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to teach basic skills in quantum programming.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda kvantarvutite programmeerimisoskus elementaarsel tasemel.

learning_outcomes.en: The sudent who passes the course
- has mastered the notion of a two dimensional quantum system: state, unitary evolution of state, measurement
learning_outcomes.et: - on omandanud 2-dimensionaalse kvantsüsteemi mõiste: olek, oleku unitaarne evolutsioon, mõõtmine;

learning_outcomes.en: - is able to describe the behavior of a two dimensional quantum system on the Bloch sphere
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab kirjeldada 2-tasemelise kvantsüsteemi käitumist Blochi sfääri abil;

learning_outcomes.en: - has mastered the notion of superposition and entanglement in simple cases
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb põimituse ja superpositsioon mõisteid ja oskab näitlikustada lihtsamatel juhtudel;

learning_outcomes.en: - has mastered the notion of a digital quantum computer: quantum bit (qubit), gates, circuits, carrying out quantum computation using these elements
learning_outcomes.et: - on omandanud digitaalse kvantarvuti mõiste: kvantbitt, ahelad, väratid, kvantarvutuse kirjeldamine nende abil;

learning_outcomes.en: - is able to use free software packages (eg IBM QISKIT or ProjectQ) to compute simple quantum circuits
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab kasutada olemasolevat vabavaralist tarkvara (nt IBM QISKIT või ProjectQ) lihtsamate kvantahelate arvutamiseks;

learning_outcomes.en: - can implement, on a gate-based digital quantum computer such as IBM Q, the time-evolution of a quantum system
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab implementeerida lihtsamate kvantsüsteemide evolutsiooni  väratipõhisel kvantarvutil nagu nt IBM Q.

description.et:
Kokku on 11 kodutööd (6 teoreetilist ja 5 programmeerimises), kus iga kodutöö on maksimaalselt 20 punkti. Maksimaalne punktide arv on 220.

There are 11 homework assignments (6 theory and 5 programming labs) total with each homework max 20 points. The total score is max 220 points.

grade_preconditions.et:
To be eligible for grading, you need to: (1) participate in at least 50% of classroom theory meetings; (2) participate in at least 50% of programming lab classroom meetings.

Hindamisele pääsevad kõik, kes on: (1) osa võtnud vähemalt 50% teoreetilise osa auditoorsest tööst; (2) 50% programmeerimise laboritest.

grade_evaluation.et:
You need to score at least 50% in homework and 50% in programming labs *separately* to pass the course. In other words, one needs at least 50% of points in each category to pass the course.

Lõplik tulemus kujuneb kõikide punktide summana ja kursuse on läbinud see, kes saab vähemalt 50% koduülesannete punktidest ja 50% programmeerimise ülesannetest *eraldi*. See tähendab, et mõlemas kategoorias peab saama vähemalt 50% punktidest.

debt_elimination.et: Arvestuse  kordussooritus (mille põhjuseks võib olla kas mittepositiivne hinne või arvestusele mitteilmumine) on võimalik üks kord enne semestri lõppu või uue semestri esimese kahe nädala jooksul.

resources.recommended_materials:
Programming in the course is based on the Python programming language. Students who do not have basic skills in Python are advised to take an introductory course on Python or devote extra time to learning the basics of Python. Ask for advice if you need more information. 

See kursus baseerub programmeerimiskeelel Python. Tudengitel, kes pole Pythoniga varem kokku puutunud, soovitame võtta kas sissejuhatava kursuse või leida aeg iseseisvalt Pythoni algteadmiste omandamisel. Palun küsige nõu kui vajate rohkem informatsiooni ja viiteid.

name.en: Chair of Security and Theoretical Computer Science

description.et:
The course consists of two meetings every week.

MEETING_1: DISCUSSION of reading material. The student needs to work through the lecture, i.e. the reading material, prior to the meeting. In the meeting, we will discuss the questions raised in the text.

MEETING_2: PRACTICE session:
- Theory session (1st half the semester);
- Programming lab session (2nd half of the semester).

1 - INTRODUCTION
1.1 - Introduction. What is quantum computing? Structure of a physical theory.

2 - BASIC LINEAR ALGEBRA
2.1 - Matrix manipulation. Addition. Multiplication. Inner product. Outer product. Operator action. Multiplication by numbers. Dirac notation.
2.2 - Geometry. Vectors and coordinates. Multiplication by numbers. Inner product and orthogonality. Basis. Visualization of operator action. Outer product and projection.

2.3 - Complex world. Complex numbers and their algebra. Complex matrices. Products and sums. Hermitian and complex conjugation.
2.4 - Generalization. Axioms of real and complex vector spaces. Hilbert spaces (finite dimensional)

3 - QUANTUM MECHANICS
3 - Quantum mechanics. Three postulates. State space. Unitary evolution. Pauli matrices.
3.1 - Quantum measurement. Eigenstates and eigenvalues. Spectral decomposition. Measurement in a basis. Expectation value. Unitary evolution vs measurement.

4 - QUANTUM COMPUTING
4.1 - Single qubit. Classical bits and circuits. Global vs relative phase. Bloch sphere visualization. Single qubit operations. Rotations. S- and T-gates. Pauli algebra. Measurement.

4.2 - Two qubits. Composite systems. Tensor product states. Tensor product operators. Transpose, conjugate and adjoint. Scalar product. Kronecker product. Entanglement. Two qubit gates. Controlled-U gate. Universality. Composite measurement. Measurement of subsystems.
4.3 - Quantum circuits. Measurement in different basis. No cloning theorem.
4.4 - Quantum algorithms. Parallel quantum computation. Phase kick back. Deutsch's algorithm

5 - QUANTUM SIMULATION
5.1 - Overview. The Schroedinger equation and Hamiltonian. Example of Ising spins. Time evolution in the Ising model.
5.2 - The Schroedinger equation. Derivatives and initial value problem. Solution to the Schroedinger equation. Matrix (or operator) exponentials.

5.3 - Implementation on a quantum computer. Overview of simulation on quantum computers. Implementation commuting Hamiltonians. Non-commuting Hamiltonians. Trotterization. Single-step and multi-step approximation. Complexity of circuits.
